subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... I will have to do some serious work with NUnit to begin to appreciate the value of using attributes over inheritance to label test classes, fixtures, and
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:

> > -- annotations for test fixture, test method, setup method, teardown
> > method, fixture setup method, fixture teardown method, test category
> > a la NUnit
>
> Annotations for test methods sounds like a reasonable idea. Why would
> you want this for setup etc. ? What's a test category?

I will have to do some serious work with NUnit to begin to appreciate
the value of using attributes over inheritance to label test classes,
fixtures, and so on. The notion that MyTestCase extends TestCase is
responsible for /so much/ of the body of work related to JUnit, that I
have no way to comprehend what limitations evaporated by removing this
constraint. Unfortunately, I have no burning need for a big C# project,
and the tools as they are today suck large. I prefer not to return to
the Stone Age of Visual C# .NET in order to learn these things. :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
